Description: Papyrus containing 12 lines of Greek text on the recto and 18 lines on the verso. The text on the recto contains an account of payments for transport from villages in different toparchies. The text on the verso contains a letter.
Bibliographic references: Grenfell & Hunt 1920 / Oxyrhynchus Papyri 14 (1669 and 1748 (pp.125-26 and 178))
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (31805) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/31805)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Colgate Rochester Divinity School
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.Oxy. XIV 1669 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: P.Oxy. XIV 1748 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
